original_title: Sri Lanka gives extra month to buy vehicles, licenses, and property sans income tax file
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has extended by one month the deadline to buy property and cars without opening a tax file, State Minister for Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya has said.
The decision to open a tax file before buying an vehicle, a revenue license or property from January 2024 has been extended by one-month, Minister Siyambalapitiya said.
There is an online process for everyone to open a tax file, he said.
However income tax has to be paid by persons earning more than 100,000 rupees a month. (Colombo/30/2023)
